FuncDef:
The location command binds the CPU of a service board in the service-location backup view.
The undo location command cancels the configuration.
By default, the CPU of a service board is not bound in the service-location backup view.
CLIs: location slot <slot-id> [ { card <card-id> | engine <engine-id> } [ backup slot <slot-id> { card <card-id> | engine <engine-id> } ] ]
undo location slot <slot-id> [ { card <card-id> | engine <engine-id> } [ backup slot <slot-id> { card <card-id> | engine <engine-id> } ] ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the slot ID of a service board.
The value is a string of 1 to 15 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Specifies the slot ID of a backup service board.
-

Specifies the CPU ID of a subcard on a service board.
The value is an integer ranging from 0 to 1.

Specifies the CPU ID of a service board. This parameter can only be configured on a VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
The value can be 0 or 3.

Examples: [*HUAWEI-service-location-1] location slot 1 card 0 backup slot 2 card 0
ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
HA hot backup cannot be performed between CPUs of one VSUF, and the slot IDs of the master and slave VSUFs must be different. To bind the CPU of a service board in the service-location backup view and configure service-location backup information, run the location command. If only the primary VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S but not the secondary VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S is configured, this command is used only for service direction.
Precautions
In a DS-Lite dynamic load balancing scenario, CPUs mapped to service-location backup groups bound to instances cannot back up each other. In addition, these CPUs mapped to service-location backup groups must reside in different locations.
In a NAT dynamic load balancing scenario, CPUs mapped to service-location backup groups bound to instances cannot back up each other. In addition, these CPUs mapped to service-location backup groups must reside in different locations.
This command is applicable only to the VSUF-80/VSUF-160/VSUI-160-E/VSUI-400/VSUI-400-E/VSUI-400A/VSUI-400A-E/VSUI-400-S/VSUI-400A-S.
